@access.description:
syntax: `@access <public|protected|package|private>`
Alias are @public, @protected, @package and @private.
Specify the access level of this member (private, package-private, public, or protected).
https://jsdoc.app/tags-access.html

@desc.description:
syntax: `@desc <description>`
<description> supports markdown.
Normally you don't need to use @desc, because first section in doc comment is determined automatically as @desc.
https://jsdoc.app/tags-description.html

@example.description:
syntax: `@example <JavaScript>`
Provide an example of how to use a documented item.
https://esdoc.org/manual/tags.html#-example

@ignore.description:
syntax: `@ignore`
The identifier is not displayed in document, Omit a symbol from the documentation.
https://jsdoc.app/tags-ignore.html

@see.description:
syntax: `@see <URL>`
Refer to some other documentation for more information.
https://tsdoc.org/pages/tags/see/

@since.description:
syntax: `@since <version>`
When was this feature added?
https://jsdoc.app/tags-since.html

@todo.description:
syntax: `@todo <description>`
Document tasks to be completed.
https://jsdoc.app/tags-todo.html

@version.description:
syntax: `@version <version>`
Documents the version number of an item.
https://jsdoc.app/tags-version.html

body: * Use of this source code is governed by an MIT-style license that can be
* found in the LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.
@license.description:
Identify the license that applies to this code.
Uses a standard open-source license, consider using the appropriate identifier from the Software Package Data Exchange (SPDX) License List (https://spdx.org/licenses/)
https://jsdoc.app/tags-license.html
